A me non piace solo lo xen, non so il motivo... Solo, non mi piace

I would like to preface this review by saying that this comes from someone who doesn't play many shooter games, as the genre doesn't appeal to me often... that being said:

I played through the entire Half-Life saga a few weeks ago (well, the main saga. Haven't bothered with Blue Shift or anything like that)... and honestly, Half-Life 1 had a better game feel to me than Half-Life 2. Don't get me wrong, Half-Life 1's level design feels a LIL rough around the edges at times, and Half-Life 2 has amazing things like the gravity gun... but I still felt like there was some spark gone from Half-Life 2. Though I will say, perhaps me playing on Easy in HL2 didn't help... but HL2 was scummy in that regard. It didn't prompt me with difficulty at the start like HL1, so I just thought the series regressed on offering difficulty instead of hiding it in the options menu... So I played most of the game on Easy... but even when I switched back to Normal, it still didn't have much of HL1's spark.

Perhaps that spark, and lack of it in 2 is owed partially to the fact that Freeman is actually much faster in Half-Life 1? Running is your DEFAULT in HL1, and it's really nice, and the speed makes HL2 feel sluggish in comparison at times. However, HL1 does have low moments and high moments. I'd consider the game at its strongest more-so in the beginning when you're running around the facility, squeezing through vents, fighting aliens, and engaging with scientists and stuff... and weaker on the surface where you're getting bombarded with countless generic military soldiers. And it doesn't help Half-Life 2 that it doubled down on the soldiers thing... granted, the Combine are at least a LIL more unique than the military, but not by much.

I also think the environments and graphics are better in HL1 honestly. "Roxy, that's insane, they massively improved the graphics between games. The set pieces are bigger and more elaborate and-" Yes. the graphics did get more elaborate and TECHNICALLY improved... and perhaps this isn't a widespread opinion... but I think the chunky low poly Black Mesa facility is more visually pleasing than the muddy overworld of City 17 and beyond (granted, Episode 2 got better about this). The chunky low poly humans also aged better than the mid 2000's-revolutionary-for-the-time-humans.

If I ever felt like replaying a Half-Life game again, it'd probably be this one. Half-Life 2 had a better more evolved narrative, but Half-Life 1 had better game-feel, and that's what replayability is gonna favor.

[h1] Half-Life [/h1]

[b] A Classic Shooter That Every FPS Fan Should Experience [/b]

Half-Life doesn't need a lot said about it: it is one of the most groundbreaking FPS games of the 90's, and possibly of all time. It introduced storytelling through environment and level design that had never been accomplished within a game before, while also providing good shooting mechanics alongside it. While the shooting has aged a bit due to the game being 20+ years old at this point, it is serviceable enough. I found the ability to kill any NPC without guidance pretty interesting for a game from 1998, and its still rare to see in linear shooters nowadays. 

Interestingly enough, it allows the player to make Gordan Freeman into a vessel for whatever character they idealized him to be, and this freedom created a sense of immersion that was not accomplished in a FPS, or really any video game until the release of [b] Half-Life [/b]. While there are some flaws such as accurate hitscan weaponry for the enemy soldiers, as well as a pretty awful set of final Xen levels, it is still an amazing game. Overall, I would highly [b] Recommend [/b] this title, as it is one of the early gaming industry's finest accomplishments and serves as a pivotal moment for the FPS genre alongside other games such as [b] DOOM [/b].

[h2] Final Verdict: 8/10 (Great) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37542043-ADHD-Reviews/

For the past year I've been going through a bunch of the classic 90s FPSes I haven't really played through; Doom 2, Final Doom, Heretic, Hexen, Quakes 1 and 2, as well fantastic throwback FPSes like DUSK and AMID EVIL as well as replaying Blood through the remaster. So I finally got around to Half Life 1, having only played 2, which I wasn't really a big fan of. Well I've come to the conclusion that I'm not much of a fan in Half-Life in general because HL1 feels like Valve looked at Quake 2 and said, "You know what would make this game better? Terrible platforming and annoying insta-kill gimmicks!"

HL1 has aged like milk and its even more obvious having recently played the aforementioned Doom 2, Quakes, and Blood which all have aged so much better than HL1, which is a janky exercise in tedium and bullet sponge enemies. And the real kicker is I haven't even gotten to Xen yet, so I haven't even seen the absolute nadir of this game that even fans hate. I'm genuinely morbidly curious to see that. Honestly I think Half Life 1 did more harm to the genre than help, because 2000's FPSes took turns for the worst for the most part by emulating this game.

People have their rose tinted glasses on way too tight for this game, its really not worth your time anymore. Most modern FPSes are superior as well as the FPSes that came before it.

*Edit* Xen really is garbage, this game isn't good and honestly this series is better off dead to be brutally honest.

This was fun to play through before I realized there was Black Mesa out. Basically a recreation of this original Half-Life game. TBH If you just try to immersive yourself into the game in the year 1998 when this game came out, the graphics are better than other games of it's time. The game play mechanics basically set the standards for modern FPS games for the future to come. This game is an original work of art. I recommend getting it on a special Valve game sale. Where you could get every Valve game ever released for a good price.
